courses.title: Relativity

groups.name: Group A: Special Theory of Relativity
topics: Inertial and non-inertial frames, Michelson Morley experiment, Galilean transformation, Lorentz transformation and its consequences.
Variation of mass with velocity, mass energy equivalence, energy momentum relation, transformation of momentum and energy, relativistic Lagrangian and Hamiltonian formulation.

Minkowski space, space-like, time-like and singular intervals, space-like vectors, time-like vectors, four vectors, relativistic formulation of the equation of motion and covariant four dimensional formulations of the laws of mechanics.

groups.name: Group B: General Theory of Relativity
topics: Quotient law, Christoffel’s three index symbols, geodesics, covariant differentiation of vectors, tensors and invariant, Ricci’s theorem, tensor form of gradient, divergence, Laplacian and curl, geodesic co-ordinates, Riemann Christoffel tensor, Ricci tensor, Bianchi identities, Einstein tensor, construction of a uniform vector field and necessary and sufficient condition for the flat spacetime.

Principle of general covariance, principle of equivalence, inertial and gravitational mass, Newton’s equation of motion as an approximation of geodesic equations, deduction and solution of Einstein’s field equations, Poisson’s equations as an approximation of Einstein’s field equations, planetary orbits, three tests of general relativity and time delay of light.

courses.title: Electrodynamics
courses.description:
1. Maxwell's equations:
Introduction, Maxwell’s electromagnetic field equations and their development and physical significances; Electromagnetic energy, Poynting’s theorem; Wave equations in vacuum; Plane monochromatic waves in non-conducting and conducting media and their solutions; Skin depth; Wave equation with sources.

2. Application of Maxwell's equations:
Boundary conditions; Reflection and Refraction at the boundary of two non conducting media; Normal and oblique incidence; Total internal reflection; Snell’s law; Brewster’s law; Reflection from a conducting plane.

3. Guided Wave propagation:
Wave propagation between parallel conducting plates; Wave guides; Modes of propagation of TE, TM and TEM waves; Cavity resonators; Radiation from an oscillating electric dipole; Radiation resistance; Radiation from a half‑wave antenna; Radiation from a group of moving charges.

4. Electromagnetic Potentials and Fields:
Scalar and vector potentials; Gauge transformation, Coulomb gauge, Lorentz gauge; Retarded potentials; Liénard–Wiechert potentials; Field due to uniformly moving point charge; Power radiated by an accelerated charge.

5. Electromagnetic Dispersion:
Dispersive power of a prism; Lorentz’s theorem; Normal and anomalous dispersion; Clausius–Mossotti relation.

6. Scattering of Electromagnetic Radiation:
Thomson scattering; Rayleigh scattering; Resonant scattering; Blueness of the sky and ocean.

7. Concepts of Plasma:
Debye screening length; Plasma behaviour in fields; Langevin equation; Pinch effect; Plasma oscillations.
recommendedBooks: Milford & Christy Foundations of Electromagnetic Theory
J.D. Jackson Classical Electrodynamics
David J. Griffiths Introduction to Electrodynamics (3rd edition)
Landau & Lifshitz Classical Theory of Fields
A.M.H. Rashid Classical Electrodynamics
M. Wazed Miah Fundamentals of Electromagnetism
B. S. Tanenbaum Plasma Physics
M. R. Islam Lecture Notes on Electrodynamics (unpublished)
